duties_responsibilities.duty: Strategize, plan, and oversee execution of direct mail and digital solicitation of approximately 10,000 prospects per year.
Secure new, renewed, or increased funding from individuals through online giving, direct mail and digital campaigns, special events and direct proposals.
Liaise with the Department of Philanthropy Operations to ensure accurate entry, reporting, and stewardship activity; gift processing and reporting for the LHDCMC Foundation.

Keep up to date with industry fundraising technology, best practices, and environmental trends, utilizing a variety of media channels to reach donors in their preferred communication style and educating the team on trends and technologies that can enhance Foundation efforts and success.

Support the planning and execution of donor cultivation and donor stewardship events. Work closely with other Foundation staff members to contribute to a comprehensive MOVES management plan and develops short and long-term business plans, as appropriate.
Ensure that all patient solicitations are in keeping with HIPAA law. Participate in professional networks to maintain current knowledge of laws and techniques.
Function as a key member of the Foundation fundraising team and provide additional support as requested to ensure the success of the Foundation in its mission and goals.

education_certification.credential: BA/BS in a related field. Fundraising experience may be substituted on a year-for-year basis for up to four years of the required education.
